intro: Amsinckia intermedia var. saint-nicolai, commonly known as the Saint-Nicolas plant, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
